metadata.title: The Atlantic Road
metadata.story: Driving The Atlantic Road was great fun, with plenty of amazing scenery along the way. This stop, at a famous Bridge along the route was a highlight. We didn't plan to stop there for long, but ended up spending about an hour walking along the highway to get photos and watch people fish.
metadata.altText: Looking down a two-lane highway road that turns right towards a bridge which arches towards the sky.

metadata.title: Grasslands and fjords
metadata.story: Road trips and relaxing. Norway did the trick with both.
metadata.altText: A fjord stretches out to the horizon, with a bridge crossing in the distance. The foreground is a grassy field with a few trees.

metadata.title: Reflection of a house
metadata.story: When we started driving in Norway, we found it hard not to stop every few kilometers at another place that just made us go "wow!!". This photo was taken during a quick lunch stop on our first day driving from Bergen to Oda.
metadata.altText: A house and bridge is reflected in the still waters of a fjord. The sky is overcast, and the water is calm.

metadata.title: Boat on the fjord
metadata.altText: Wooden boat huts sit on the edge of a fjord, with a small boat moored in front of them. The water is calm and the sky is overcast. Mountains in the background have low cloud cover.
metadata.story: Serene scenes like this were common while we drove alongside the fjords in Norway. Unfortunately for us we had mostly rainy weather during the day, otherwise we would have probably taken our chances to jump in as well!

metadata.title: Fruit stall
metadata.altText: A white hut with red trimming and a black roof sits in a pulloff area by a road. It has a Norwegian flag flying from its roof. Inside are a collection of fruits and berries for sale. There's no person at the stall, it's based on an honesty system.
metadata.story: Probably my favourite part of driving around Norway during the summer was stopping off at little roadside stalls like this one that dotted the countryside. In each was a different selection of local fruits and vegetables for sale, most of the time paid for by putting some cash into an honesty box. The berries were absolutely fantastic, better than anything I've had elsewhere.

metadata.title: Fjord cruises
metadata.altText: A view from up high, looking down into a town by a bay in a fjord. The hills and land around the town are green, with low misty cloud floating above. There's a cruise ship parked in the center of the picture, in the middle of the bay in the fjord.
metadata.story: Tourism is a pretty big part of the economy in Norway's fjord regions, and it's not uncommon to see large cruise ships floating in the bays outside of towns in the area. It wasn't my favourite sight, but this shot did turn out pretty good, ship and all.

metadata.title: Red church
metadata.altText: A church spire bathed in sunlight. The red wood of the church building contrasts with the blue sky behind.
metadata.story: This Stave Church in Kvernes was different to the others we'd seen on our trip. It looked more like a traditional church, but inside there was still definitely a sea-faring, viking feeling that we experienced in other Stave Churches we visited.

metadata.title: Seagulls
metadata.altText: Two seagulls sitting on a railing, the Atlantic Ocean behind them.
metadata.story: Regular companions during our time on the Atlantic Coast. These two were very small compared to some of the other seagulls that we encountered.

metadata.title: A rare glimpse of sunset
metadata.altText: A concrete path leads to the water's edge between low shurbs. Small embankments dot the water, with a faint pinkish hue lighting the sky at sunset.
metadata.story: We didn't get many clear evenings while in Norway, so this sunset was pretty nice to take in after a day of driving The Atlantic Road.

metadata.title: Line ups for the ferry
metadata.altText: A car waits in a numbered line in an otherwise empty parking lot. They are waiting in a cark park by the water for the incoming ferry.
metadata.story: We got very comfortable with taking the ferry between destinations in the fjords during our time in Norway. They were well maintained, and some even had very comfortable passenger rooms where we could snack and pass the time on the (normally) short trips.

metadata.title: Expanses of water
metadata.altText: A woman with her back turned to the camera looks out across a fjord under grey, cloudy skies.
metadata.story: There were plenty of moments like this one for  reflection during our trip to Norway.

metadata.title: Learning to drive
metadata.altText: A man stands with a girl on a wooden pier, while a boy carefully navigates a small, yellow, inflatable boat towards them.
metadata.story: I captured this moment on our first day driving through Norway. It appeared to be a father helping guide his son in to dock their boat before refueling it. The mountains in the background were our destination for that evening.

metadata.title: Besides Vøringsfossen
metadata.altText: A powerful, low waterfall cascades down under a stone bridge. The shot is framed by the branches of two trees in the foreground.
metadata.story: We made a few stops during our travels at different waterfalls. This one, Vøringsfossen, felt particularly powerful on a under cloudy, foreboding skies.

metadata.title: Fjords to the left of me, mountains to the right.
metadata.altText: Looking down a wet road with a car driving off into the distance. A grassy embankment coverd in yellow flowers leads to a boad shed on the left of the frame. Meanwhile the right side if dominated by a towering mountain.
metadata.story: We drove this road besides the Hardangerfjord so many times during the couple of days we were in the area. At pretty much every turn there was something to behold - a waterfall raging besides the road, a snow-capped mountain in the distance, the silence and calmness of the fjord itself.

metadata.title: The faintest of rainbows
metadata.altText: A very faint rainbow rises into the sky above hills sparsely covered in pine trees.
metadata.story: One of the upsides of having so many rainy days during our trip was that when the sun did come out we were treated to rainbows that added to the beauty of the landscapes.

metadata.title: Stave Churches
metadata.altText: Looking up at the viking style roof of a Stave Church. The entire construction is of dark wood.
metadata.story: Stave Churches like this on in Vikøyri were a highlight to stop at. Most times you could see them from a distance, rising above the surrounding countryside with their uniquely designed roofs.

metadata.title: A quick stop
metadata.altText: A stave church sits atop a green hill.
metadata.story: We stopped at this Stave Church in Vikøyri during a long 10 hour driving day. It was a nice break to stretch our legs and take in the views of the surrounding countryside. The church itself was impressive, especially when the wind picked up and started gushing through the open doorways.

metadata.title: House on a hill.
metadata.altText: A red, two-story house sits behind a hedge in on a grassy hill. In front of the hedge are while bails of hay.
metadata.story: I don't remember taking this picture, and don't remember seeing it when I got these shots developed. But I like it. Pretty sure it's in Stave Churches

metadata.title: A way to feel small
metadata.altText: A photo taken from a ferry, looking over the water towards a valley with mountains on either side folding away into the distance. Some light rain gives the distant town and mountains a misty coating.
metadata.story: Traveling through the fjords, it was hard not to feel small while looking around at the scale and size of the surrounding scenery.

metadata.title: The power of water
metadata.altText: A waterfall crashes down beneath a viewing platform.
metadata.story: We didn't get to spend too much time at Geiranger, despite it being one of the premier tourist locations in Norway. Again, the weather got in the way, but we were fortunate enough that the rain had caused this waterfall near the visitor center to become a raging torrent. It was hard taking photos on the walk down to the lookout because we just got soaked at every stop.

metadata.title: No context toilet
metadata.altText: A toilet cubicle with an image of a cow decorating one side, and a small bird decorating the other.

metadata.title: Boat at sunset
metadata.altText: A small single-mast boat sails in a lake at sunset. The lake is lit up in a orange hue, while the sky behind fades from blue to orange. Tree mask the foreground of the shot.
metadata.story: We had one night in Hamburg as we travelled from the UK to Norway. This was the sunset we were greeted with when we arrived.

metadata.title: Wind turbines from the train
metadata.altText: Wind turbines spinning in the distance, in a green field. Taken from a moving train.

metadata.title: Pigeon and scooter
metadata.altText: A rental scooter leans up against an electricity box, while a pigeon walks alongside it. A red building in the background with dark windows and white flower boxes.
metadata.story: I don't know why, but I like taking pictures of rental scooters in Europe.

metadata.title: Waterways at sunset
metadata.altText: A building sits between two canals that branch off. The scene is dark, with only the sunset in the background illuminating part of the shot.
metadata.story: After a long day walking, we reached the canal district of Hamburg at sunset. While we didn't go on a cruise, we did wander around the old warehouses which are now home to some trendy companies.

metadata.title: Summer by the lake
metadata.altText: People sit facing a lake under the summer sun & clear skies. A gyser in the middle of the lake shoots water into the sky, creating a small rainbow.
metadata.story: I think we were eating ice cream by this time of the day.

metadata.title: St Pauli Bunker
metadata.altText: A large concrete construction rises up into the frame. It is covered topped with trees and greenery.
metadata.story: The St Pauli Bunker is immense. It dominates the skyline of the surrounding area, and would have been something to behold during the war I'm sure. It's now open to tourists who can climb to the top, get a coffee or a meal on the way up. I even think I saw a hotel inside.

metadata.title: Hamburg from up high
metadata.altText: A lookout over the skyline of Hamburg. Several spires poke out admist the otherwise lowrise buildings.

metadata.title: Sunset by the lake
metadata.altText: Boats are moared in a lake as the sun sets behind buildings in the distance. In the foreground the shapes of some people can be seen sitting looking out over the lake.
metadata.story: The scene around Außenalster (Outer Alster Lake) at sunset of a Summer's day.

metadata.title: Light through the station
metadata.altText: Rays of sunlight shine through a clock tower sitting above a glass covering. Whispy clouds over the blue sky in the background.
metadata.story: A sunset picture from outside Hamburg railway station. One of the pleasures of a European Summer is having the sun up so late into the day - I think this photo was taken after dinner (maybe around 9:30pm).

metadata.title: Rathaus
metadata.altText: A sign saying 'Rathaus' is in the foreground of the image, place on a steel railing. In the background is an old brick building with a sign saying 'Schlussel Keller'.
metadata.story: Central Hamburg, around the Town Hall, is a mix of old buildings and new constructions. Like most places these days, even the older buildings are starting to become home to newer, trendier shops and eateries.

metadata.title: St Pauli Bunker
metadata.altText: A concrete building dominates the sky. It's base is bare, but the top is covered with trees.

metadata.title: Gravestones
metadata.altText: Three gravestones are in the foreground of this picture, with lush grass and a stone wall leading separating them from a house.
metadata.story: Wandering around the villages in The Cotswolds, you'd pretty often find graveyards and relics tucked away besides and around churches in the area.

metadata.title: St Paul's
metadata.altText: The white dome of St Paul's Cathedral in London rises up between office buildings.
metadata.story: After a day walking around different boroughs in London, we crossed the River Thames and made our way towards St Paul's Cathedral.

metadata.title: Brige to St Paul's
metadata.altText: People walking on a bridge, with the white domed roof of St Paul's Cathedral in the background.
metadata.story: St Paul's Cathedral basking in the evening light, as seen from Millennium Bridge.

metadata.title: Artists.
metadata.altText: Two people, silhoutted, sitting on the floor in a tunnel. The walls are covered in bright grafitti, with some light coming in from an opening on the right of the frame.
metadata.story: We saw a few artists at work as we wandered through The Graffiti Tunnel during the afternoon. This picture captures a couple sitting down to rest with some snacks.

metadata.title: Spongebob + Rhino
metadata.altText: A grafitti wall featuring a Spongebob artwork next to a Banksy-style artwork of a girl holding a rhino with a red ribbon.

metadata.title: An eye on ice cream
metadata.altText: An ice cream van stopped on Westminster Bridge with the London Eye in the background.
metadata.story: We walked over Westminster Bridge in the afternoon after spending a bit of time inside the Houses of Parliament. I was starting to get hungry, and probably low on energy too so probably had my mind on something sweet when taking this shot.

metadata.title: Pigeon house
metadata.altText: Pigeons roosting around a windown on the upper floor of a stone brick house.
metadata.story: Pigeons are interesting creatures.

metadata.title: Parklife
metadata.altText: People sunbathing in a park outside the Houses of Parliament in London.
metadata.story: On our way through Westminster we wandered into this park next to the Houses of Parliament. Saw two news crews going about their business, plus many more locals taking advantage of the balmy weather.

metadata.title: Old stone
metadata.altText: An old stone house sitting at the end of a sandy path. Tree branches overhead frame the shot.
metadata.story: Houses like these were something we got very used to seeing during the few days we spent in The Cotswolds.

metadata.title: The Slaughters
metadata.altText: A stream flows through the town of Upper Slaughter in The Cotswolds. Stone brick houses line the roads to either side.
metadata.story: We got told to go to The Slaughters to get capture some idilic Cotswold scenery. Despite the name, they didn't disappoint during the time we spent there.

metadata.title: Fish 'n Chips
metadata.altText: Sauce bottles sit neatly on a table. Retro figurines and trinkits line the wall.
metadata.story: Kay spent some time in the UK as a student, and had memories of getting takeaway fish and chips from Poppies at Spitalfields on her way home from class.

metadata.title: Walls
metadata.altText: Stone walls turn at sharp angles in this picture. The view is looking up at the walls & sky.
metadata.story: The walls of St Paul's Cathedral.

metadata.title: Sunset over Cheltenham
metadata.altText: A flock of sheep stand mid picture in a field that is blazing orange in sunset light. A lone tree stands at the center of the shot in the distance.
metadata.story: We headed up to Cleeve Hill outside of Cheltenham on a perfectly clear evening. We got up there just in time for sunset, which we shared with the flocks of sheep that roam the top of the hill.

metadata.title: Phone box library
metadata.altText: A red phone booth stands at the entrance of a laneway. Inside teh phone booth are books.

metadata.title: Broadway
metadata.altText: A lone tower stands in a field with grey skies. The Union Jack flag flies atop it.
metadata.story: After a failed attempt to visit the previous day, we manage to get to Broadway Tower just as the rain was rolling in. An 18th century tower standing in field atop a hill. Pretty random, but pretty good.

metadata.title: Fields
metadata.altText: Rolling green fields with patchworked by fences. Blue skies with fluffy clouds overhead.
metadata.story: Standard Cotswold scene really.

metadata.title: Yo
metadata.altText: A sheep stands in the center of the frame, looking directly into the camera.

metadata.title: Driveway
metadata.altText: A dirt driveway goes into the distance, under the cover of trees. Tall grass lines both sides of the driveway.
metadata.story: The driveway of the BnB we stayed at during our time in The Cotswolds. Once a working farm, the owners have taken a step back in their older age, and welcome guests from time to time at their property. We felt very lucky that they had a place for us.

metadata.title: High Street
metadata.altText: Two ladies walking down a lane that falls away out of the shot. Its entrance is between two old brick buildings, one which has a street sign saying 'High Street'.

metadata.title: Photographer
metadata.altText: A woman stands behind a sheep taking a photo of the person taking a photo of her. The scene is bathed in the orange glow of sunset.
metadata.story: I'm not sure how many photos of sheep we both ended up with on our camera rolls, but at least we got one of each other.

metadata.title: Red car. Fast car.
metadata.altText: A red sports car is parked in front of an old stone brick house.
metadata.story: There's plenty of wealthy folks frequenting The Cotswolds.  Being so close to London, it's an easy weekend getaway for folks working in The City, something we our hosts during our stay dreaded as prices increased and outsiders moved in.

metadata.title: Man at sunset
metadata.altText: The figure of a man is in the distance, walking away from the camera as the sunsets to his left.
metadata.story: The guy in the distance arrived at Clove Hill the same time as we did. But he obviously had somewhere to be and wasn't spending any time taking photos of the sheep.

metadata.title: More sheep at sunset.
metadata.altText: Sheep grazing in a field bathed in orange light from the setting sun.
metadata.story: More sheep. 'nuf said.

metadata.title: Blocked off Broadway Tower
metadata.altText: A stone tower stands in a field.
metadata.story: Unfortunately our first attempt to get to Broadway Tower was blocked because we got there just in time to see the gates to the car park closing.

metadata.title: Bollards
metadata.altText: Four bollards lined up across two lanes of a road. Each bollard is bent slightly off center.
metadata.story: There's something about the alignment of these bollards. Either that, or I took this photo trying to get through to the end of a roll.

metadata.title: Roses on yellow
metadata.altText: A rose bush grows up a yellow wall.

metadata.title: Food vans and their fans
metadata.altText: People enjoying the late afternoon sun walk past and line up at food vans that are parked besides the gravel pathway.
metadata.story: We stumbled across this food festival near our hotel in Copenhagen on our first evening there. We snacked there before walking further away for dinner, but made sure to get back another day before we left.

metadata.title: Knippelsbro
metadata.altText: A man walks over a bridge towards the camera. There is a roadway next to him that has some cars on it. A strange round control tower is to his right, just off the edge of the bridge.
metadata.story: We crossed this bridge heading to Christianshavn several times during our stay in Copenhagen. For some reason I really liked the oval control towers that were on it (the white building sitting on a green stem to the right of the photo).

metadata.title: Relaxing in a royal park
metadata.altText: A couple lays on the grass in a park surrounded by trees. A palace is centered in the back of the photo.
metadata.story: The park outside Rosenborg Slot made for a nice place to stroll during the afternoon. Unlike the locals, though, we had places to be and things to see so didn't spend too long lounging about.

metadata.title: Ski hill on a factory
metadata.altText: The green slopes of a ski hill run down away from the smoke stacks of the factory below.
metadata.story: Apparently on sunnier, less windy days there's a lot going on at CopenHill. But there wasn't much happening when we were there, and the whole place felt kinda sad and weird.

metadata.title: To the toilet
metadata.altText: A sign for a public toilet is plastered with stickers. In the background a row of pride flags blow in the breeze.

metadata.title: Tiny coffee house
metadata.altText: A small coffee house is in an old looking hectagonal building. It is in the middle of a bicycle parking lot, with bikes littered around it. Customers sit at the open windows facing the barista on the inside.
metadata.story: A cool look tiny coffee house next to a station and bicycle parking lot. Copenhagen's bike culture was something else man!

metadata.title: Rosenborg Slot
metadata.altText: The spires of Rosenborg Palance rise above the brick building that once housed the King of Denmark. Visitors enter through a gate at the bottom of the photo.
metadata.story: We took an early morning guided tour of Rosenborg Slot, and avoided the crowds to a degree. The tour itself was really interesting, going into Danish history and the ups and downs of the Royal Family's power and wealth.

metadata.title: Happy hour
metadata.altText: Two men sit at a table with a beverage each. The roof overhead lets in plenty of natural light.

metadata.title: Gloomy Nyhavn
metadata.altText: Boats line the banks of Nyhavn in Copenhagen. Besides them, tourists walk past restaurants along the shoreline.
metadata.story: Although it's one of the famous locations in Copenhagen, we didn't go to Nyhavn for more than 5 minutes. That's how long it took for us to take a couple of photos and for the rain to roll in, which was our sign that it was time to head home.

metadata.title: A bit of colour
metadata.altText: A mural of a man leaning over a lake under a full moon is painted on the side of an apartment. The buildings around it all have a monotone dull brick colour, making the mural stand out.

metadata.title: Bike walking
metadata.altText: A woman walks her bicycle against the backdrop of a bright yellow building.

metadata.title: Canal life
metadata.altText: Houseboats line a canal, parked under green trees.
metadata.story: On sunnier days we say plenty of people hopping into boats and going out on the water for late evening excursions with friends, colleagues, and family.

metadata.title: Bikes, bikes, and more bikes
metadata.altText: Bikes parked along a wall on a cobbled pavement.
metadata.story: Man, Copenhagen's biking culture. 👨‍🍳😙

metadata.title: Wonderland in our hands
metadata.altText: A boy climbs into the hands of a giant wooden troll statue. A mural painted behind it says 'Wonderland - The World is in our hands'.
metadata.story: Freetown Christiania was an interesting place. Our visit there was cut short by the rainy weather, so we didn't get to do too much wandering around the different streets and places located there.

metadata.title: Copenhagen sunset
metadata.altText: A view of the Copenhagen skyline at sunset, church spires rise up above the otherwise low-rised buildings.
metadata.story: We climbed up to the top of the spire at Vor Frelsers Kirke just in time to be told to 'hurry up and get down, we are closing'. The kid who made the trek up to tell us that was kind enough to let us enjoy the sunset for a moment before heading down. Turns out it's his job to walk up and down making sure people keep moving and ensuring the passage up the spire are clear.

metadata.title: The place to be
metadata.altText: The word Danmark spelt out in individual characters for an art work.

metadata.title: Philippines v. Scotland Mixed Open.
metadata.altText: A boy dives forward with one hand holding a rugby ball. Two defenders in blue Scotland shirts reach down to try and touch him.
metadata.story: A fantastic, fast flowing game of footy. We played Scotland in our pool games, and they were a fast, physical side. The Philippines were a young squad with plenty of talent.

metadata.title: Philippines v. Scotland Mixed Open.
metadata.altText: A boy in a blue Scotland shirt shapes to pass a rugby ball. A young player in a red and yellow Philippines vest reaches out to make a touch.

metadata.title: Try awarded. Philippines v. Scotland Mixed Open.
metadata.altText: A referee wearing white points to the mark while awarding a try. They are holding their whistle to their mouth, their cheeks puffed. Players from both teams walk away, backs turned to the camera.
metadata.story: Not only were we supporting the players in this game, but a few of us were also there supporting our friends who were refereeing. Without them, there's no game.

metadata.title: Philippines v. Scotland Mixed Open.
metadata.altText: A boy dives forward with one hand holding a rugby ball. Two defenders in blue Scotland shirts reach down to try and touch him.

metadata.title: Tonga v. Japan Mens Open
metadata.altText: A man wearing a blue Japanese shirt dives low for the scoreline, holding a rugby ball in one hand. Two players wearing red Tonga shirts reach down to try and touch him.
metadata.story: We became friends with the Tongan Mens team over the course of the tournament. We shared accommodation with them, and our two teams really grew close over shared meals and socials. Which made watching this game tough, because we also had many friends in the Japanese team, who we've got to know over the years.

metadata.title: Strike dump. Tonga v. Japan Mens Open
metadata.altText: A player wearing a blue Japanese shirt leans in to touch a Tongan defender. The Japanese player is holding a rugby ball in one hand, ready to place it on the ground after the touch.

metadata.title: A team. A family.
metadata.altText: Players wearing blue and white Chinese Taipei shirts stand in a circle in the middle of a field.
metadata.story: Our Taiwan (Chinese Taipei) team came together from all parts of the world for this tournament. It was great to player with some of the younger players who I've seen grow up as people and as Touch players.

metadata.title: Touch made. Australia v USA Womens Open
metadata.altText: An Australian player wearing a yellow vest leans in to make a touch on a USA player wearing a red vest.
metadata.story: Team USA's Womens Open playing group also had a large representation of players who'd grown up learning their Touch in Taiwan. We got out to support them whenever we could.

metadata.title: Tonga v. Japan Mens Open
metadata.altText: A Japanese player wearing a blue shirt runs through a gap between two Tongan players in red. He holds the ball in two hands, looking for a teammate to pass to.

metadata.title: Tonga ❤️
metadata.altText: A crowd of people sit by the sideline of a playing field, with a large Tongan flag in the center of their group.
metadata.story: This Tongan flag was huge, and the team brought it with them all the way from New Zealand. We really enjoyed supporting the Tongan team during the tournament, and appreciated the love they gave back to us when we were playing.

metadata.title: Practice
metadata.altText: A boy wearing a blue and white Chinese Taipei hoodie throws a pass to a teammate off screen.
metadata.story: Our team really only came together for the first time in the week leading into the tournament. Our playing style, cohesion, and team dynamics took time to bed in but we stuck at it and supported each other for the two weeks we were together.

metadata.title: Kreuzberg sunset
metadata.altText: Looking down a street line with parked cars towards the setting sun.
metadata.story: Our first evening in Berlin after landing that morning. We were doing our best to keep going despite the jet lag. This sunset as we walked around Kreuzberg certainly helped.

metadata.title: Sunset from Viktoriapark
metadata.altText: Church spires stick up above the skyline that's also dotted with trees. The setting sun in the background casts a orange and purple hue.
metadata.story: More wandering on our first day in Berlin. The 20 hours of travel from Taipei was taking its toll, but we made it to our destination at Viktoriapark just in time to catch a wicked sunset.

metadata.title: Church. Tree. Person.
metadata.altText: A person walks through the left of this photo that captures a leafless tree standing in front of a cream coloured church building.
metadata.story: We spent a grey afternoon walking around the small town of Goslar, a few hours outside of Berlin.

metadata.title: Stream through the town
metadata.altText: A stream flows under a bridge on the right of the frame. It is flanked by cream coloured buildings on the right, and a cobbled road and more old German-style buildings on the left.
metadata.story: As the evening set in the streets of Goslar became ever quieter.

metadata.title: Cobbled streets & old houses
metadata.altText: A cobbled street curves between old, German-style houses.
metadata.story: Walking through the old streets of Goslar was a nice way to spend the afternoon. Turns out Siemens was founded there.

metadata.title: Farmer's lane
metadata.altText: A dirt road goes off into the distance between fields and two trees.
metadata.story: We stayed on a farm for a few more days in the west of German, close to the border with Belgium. It was a great change of pace after a busy week in Berlin.

metadata.title: Cochem Castle
metadata.altText: An old, stone castle sits atop a tree covered hill.
metadata.story: We spent a day in and around the old castle town of Cochem,  which sits above the Moselle River. The area was stunning, with old lanes and buildings leading up and and down the hills alongside the river valley.

metadata.title: Indian temple
metadata.altText: An ornately decorated roof of an Indian temple rises above palms trees against cloudy skies.
metadata.story: Singapore is a melting pot of cultures. Within a couple of minutes walk from this Indian temple there was a large Chinese style temple. Futher down the same road, a church sat next to a park.

metadata.title: Rainy roads to downtown
metadata.altText: A wet, rainy road lined with palm trees and older building is in the foreground, with highrise city skyscrapers in the background.
metadata.story: My first morning in Singapore, I was greeted with a sudden rainstorm just as I stepped out of my hotel. I stuck to my plan to walk to the Green IO conference venue about 30 minutes away.

metadata.title: Singapore Parliament House
metadata.altText: A stone sign saying Parliament sits in front of a neat lawn. City skyscrapers line the background.

metadata.title: Clarke to Gardens
metadata.altText: Looking down a river, flanked by an older apartment to the right. In the distance, a white bridge crosses the river, with three glass buildings poking out above it.
metadata.story: This was a regular morning view for me during my short 3 days in Singapore. Captured while walking to the Green IO conference venue at the Old Parliament House.

metadata.title: Man and mural
metadata.altText: A man wearing all black and carrying a black backpack walks by a mural showing a street stall, painted on a white building

metadata.title: Hawkers markets rock
metadata.altText: People sit at round tables eating, while others walk between carrying meals. The roof above is lined with red lanterns.
metadata.story: I almost never get meals in my hotel when staying in Singapore. Hawker Centers like this one provide a place to get affordable, fresh, local dishes with the proper amount of Singaporean spice!

metadata.title: The Pinnacle@Duxton
metadata.altText: A photo taken while crossing the road, looking down the road towars highrise residential apartments in the distance. Pedestrians cross the road in the foreground, with older Chinese style houses on the left of the road.
metadata.story: A nice sunny Singaporean afternoon walk back from the Green IO conference. This view looks down Neil Rd towards the Pinnacle@Duxton apartment complex.

metadata.title: A park in an apartment
metadata.altText: Looking up at a high rise residential building. The buildings are connected by walkways & parks on some of the upper floors.
metadata.story: This apartment building features multiple towers connected by walkways and parks connecting the buildings. Wild.

metadata.title: Exit.
metadata.altText: A man wheels his suitcase down an air bridge, preparing to board a plane. A sign at the top of the frame reads 'exit'.
metadata.story: The Green IO conference was a great experience. My time in Singapore was short, and I didn't get to catch up with the Touch folks I know there. That said, it was great to connect with more folks working in digital sustainability in Asia.

metadata.title: Tempe & Wolli Creek
metadata.altText: High rise residential apartments bathed in late afternoon sunset sit behind a park that's in the shade.
metadata.story: We landed in Sydney on a Wednesday morning, suprising Mum for her birthday. That afternoon, I drove down to near Vawdon Veledrome to train with one of our Taiwan Touch World Cup team members who lives in Sydney. It was a cold afternoon, but a good session.

metadata.title: Padstow station
metadata.altText: Looking down a partially covered train platform. The tracks are on the right of the shot, and the largely empty platform is in the center.
metadata.story: This was a view I had so much growing up. Padstow station is still the same now as it was back then.

metadata.title: Inner West bins
metadata.altText: Yellow and red capped bins sit outside houses down a narrow footpath.
metadata.story: We spent a morning hopping around cafes of the inner city suburbs of Surry Hills. The shaded streets were pretty cold and we sought out spots of sun.

metadata.title: Paddo
metadata.altText: Concrete archs rise above leafy green ferns.
metadata.story: This was a new spot, even for me. We stumbled upon Paddington Reservoir Gardens while walking up to the Centennial Park.

metadata.title: Kookaburra
metadata.altText: A kookaburra sits on a branch against a cloudy sky.

metadata.title: Centennial Park Swan
metadata.altText: A black swan swimming near the grassy banks of a lake, under cloudy skies.

metadata.title: Stanwell Tops
metadata.altText: Looking down at coastal cliffs. A beach is in the foreground, with tree covered cliffs in the backgound. The sea is to the left of the shot.
metadata.story: Stanwell Tops is one of my favourite spots down south of Sydney.

metadata.title: Kiama blowhole
metadata.altText: Against a rocky backdrop, a splash of ocean spray rises out of a blow hole. The sea is in the background.
metadata.story: After a stop for fish & chips, we got out to Kiama Blowhole. Despite the cloudy weather, we were able to walk out a bit futher from the shore, along the rocky waterfront edge.

metadata.title: On the edge
metadata.altText: A group of people sit on a rock outcrop looking out over the Tasman Sea.
metadata.story: Despite it being winter, there were plenty of people down at the blowhole in Kiama. A few, like us, chose to venture out on the rocks closer to the sea.

metadata.title: Ferry and the coat hanger
metadata.altText: An old yellow and green Sydney Ferry is sitting by the dock with the Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background.
metadata.story: On a rainy Saturday afternoon, we took Mum and Dad into the city for a posh lunch overlooking the harbour.

metadata.title: One more run down George St
metadata.altText: Looking down a rainy road, with tram tracks in the middle. The road is flanked by tall high rise office buildings.
metadata.story: While working as a paralegal during university, I made so many treks down George Street in the heart of the city. It looks so different these days without cars, being more pedestrian friendly. A nice change, Sydney. Good work.

metadata.title: Carrington Falls in the sun
metadata.altText: Sunlight baths the trees around a river and waterfall that is in the shade.
metadata.story: This show looks back at the river which rolls down and becomes Carrington Falls. In the summer, you'll find people swimming in the rock pools around the falls. But in the winter, when we went, there wasn't a soul in sight.

metadata.title: Training around
metadata.altText: A red and white train is stopped at a platform in the sunshine. The train is only partially in the shot.
metadata.story: Flying from Taipei to Amsterdam, I decided that I'd make my way around Holland and Germany entirely by train on this trip.

metadata.title: Bike paths and footpaths
metadata.altText: A person riding a bicycle in the midday sunlight rides away from the camera.
metadata.story: Although I was staying Sloterdijk in the northwest of Amsterdam, getting around to the city center and surrounding area was so easy by bike. Luckily, the time I was there was sunny so the winter cold didn't bite as hard.

metadata.title: House boats and houses
metadata.altText: A small house boat sits in a canal next to a grass embankment. Cars are parked on the streets behind, in front of brown bricke apartment buildings.
metadata.story: I didn't expect to see so many house boats of different sizes in the canals of Amsterdam. I thought it was something more common in the areas outside the big Dutch cities.

metadata.title: Vondelpark fountain
metadata.altText: A water fountain sprouts water into a lake. Trees in the background are bathe in the glow of late afternoon sunlight.
metadata.story: I met up with a friend from Taiwan and his newborn son for an afternoon drink and wander around Vondelpark. It was a good way to end my first day in the country.

metadata.altText: A path winds through a sunlit park. Winter trees dot the landscape, with a church spire in the background.
metadata.story: On my second day in Holland, I hopped on the train and made my way to Den Haag. I was there to play Touch, but had a whole day to kill. I loved wandering around the city through different parks and canal-lined streets.

metadata.title: Canals of The Hague
metadata.altText: A look down a canal, with half the frame in sunlight and the other in shade. Boats line the sunny bank on the right with classy brick houses along the road next to the canal.
metadata.story: Another photo from a great sunny afternoon walking around Den Haag.

metadata.title: Parliament & the city center
metadata.altText: A view across a lake. An island in the middle sits in front of a very old brown brick building. Glass towers rise up in the background.
metadata.story: A view from near my hotel looking across a lake towards the Dutch Parliament building with the Den Haag city center in the background.

metadata.title: Delightful Delft canals
metadata.altText: Looking down a canal lined by brick buildings. A bridge is in the middle of the frame, with a church tower in the distance background. The whole scene is filtered through late afternoon light.
metadata.story: I had a whole day in Den Haag before taking an overnight train to Berlin. I took the chance to go to the nearby town of Delft, which was even more quaint and criss-crossed by canals.

metadata.title: Oostpoort in the arvo
metadata.altText: A man rides towards the camera, while two other play with a remote controlled car walking away from the photographer. All the men are walking under the arch of an old brick building.
metadata.story: While wandering around Delft, I stumbled across this old archway on the outskirts of the town. A few folks were traveling through it, including two guys navigating a remote controlled car around the streets nearby.

metadata.title: Good evening from Den Haag
metadata.altText: Looking down a canal lined by brick houses. The canal is reflecting the later afternoon sunset .
metadata.story: I think this was the last photo I took before leaving Den Haag on the night train to Berlin. I really enjoyed the couple of days I was there, and want to make it back next time I'm in Holland.

metadata.title: LKW Tatra Motokov
metadata.altText: An old soviet-style apartment building sits across the road behind some leafless trees.
metadata.story: After realising that barely anything in Berlin was open on a Sunday, I decided to take a walk around the city. This shot was taken on the north eastern side of the city.

metadata.title: Train leaving Jannowitzbrücke
metadata.altText: Looking down a river under a blue, clouded sky. On the left, a white train sits atop a brick embankment. On the right of the image are apartment buildings in the shade.

metadata.title: Residential afternoon bliss
metadata.altText: A sunlit photo looking down a paved path in a garden. Leafless winter free can be seen throughout the photo, with some apartments on the left of the path as well.
metadata.story: I found this nice little residential area filled with parks on each block during an afternoon walk from Jannowitzbrücke to Moritzplatz.

metadata.title: 15-17 framed
metadata.altText: A house sign with the numbers '15 - 17' printed on a white plaque is stuck to a light green wall. The shot is framed by the branches of trees at the top and bottom - a cherry blossom tree at the bottom, and a spindly green bush at the bottom

metadata.title: Wind in motion
metadata.altText: A shot taken from a moving train, high grass blurred in the foreground with a white wind turbine sitting in a field behind.
metadata.story: I'm pretty sure this was taken on the train while leaving Germany heading back to Holland. I can't remember where exactly it was, but I'll say it was somewhere around Dusseldorf.

metadata.title: Berlin and the S-bahn
metadata.altText: Stone characters spell out 'Berlin', beneath an overhead S-bahn railway bridge.
metadata.story: Taken while wandering around Berlin in the very early hours of a cold Winter's day because my hotel wouldn't let me check-in.

metadata.title: Blocks of the Holocaust memorial
metadata.altText: Stone blocks of different sizes arrange in a grid pattern, taken in the early morning glow.
metadata.story: I walked through the Holocaust memorial near Brandenburg Gate in the early morning light. It was silent there, and the morning sun cast gentle shadows of the stone monuments.

metadata.title: Brandenburg Tor
metadata.altText: A goddess riding a horse-drawn chariot sits on top of a stone foundation. The shot looks upwards towards the subject, with the top two-thirds of the picture taken up by a clear blue sky.

metadata.title: A walk in the park
metadata.altText: A couple walk away from the camera down a wide dirt path. The neat lawn next to it is dotted with leafless winter trees.
metadata.story: I visited the gardens of the Charlottenburg Palace on a dreary Sunday morning. Despite the weather, there were still plenty of people wandering the gardens.

metadata.title: Residents of Alexanderplatz
metadata.altText: A grey photo looking towards a tower in the distance that features a large round ball below its tall spire. In the foreground, tree branches go across the shot with two residential buildings framing the picture.
metadata.story: Another dreary Sunday in Berlin, but I made my way out to Alexanderplatz to see if anything was open. Nothing was.

metadata.title: Taxi stop
metadata.altText: A line of yellow taxis sit beneath an overpass. Sun shines through a separation in the road above.
metadata.story: This spot is near my current home in Taipei, and always has something happening. It's a resting spot for taxi drivers, and often you'll find them in groups playing mahjong while their cars get serviced.

metadata.title: Garage exit
metadata.altText: A pale yellow wall frames the dark entrance to an underground garage. Chinese characters above indicate what it is.
metadata.story: The apartments around where I live have underground parking lots that extend the length of the street they're on. None of them are as asthetically pleasing as this one though.

metadata.title: Tropical island vibes
metadata.altText: Palm trees blow in the wind against a blue sky.
metadata.story: Taipei doesn't have much greenery, but when it does it likes to give off that tropical island vibe.

metadata.title: You Bike?
metadata.altText: Public rental bikes lined up in a row at a docking station. Their yellow tyre covers stand out against the dull concrete footpath.
metadata.story: Public bike rental stations are dotted throughout urban areas in Taiwan, and can provide a great way to get around.

metadata.title: Keeping cool
metadata.altText: An airconditioning unit sit on the roadside attached to a grey wall. Blue grafitti is painted above the box, while green leafy ferns sit on the road to the right. On its left is a street post topped with a security camera pointing away from the box.
metadata.story: Asthetically pleasing airconditioning unit.

metadata.title: Old and the new.
metadata.altText: A new high-rise apartment building is juxtaposed between two older low-rise residential apartments.
metadata.story: In Taipei you'll increasingly find juxtapositions like this one. As the city develops, old neighbourhoods are being replaced by tall glass high-rises. These often find themselves closely surrounded by other older buildings that have withstood the relentless march of urban renewal.

metadata.title: Top floor trees
metadata.altText: Trees stick out from the top corner apartments of an old, grey apartment building. They contrast the blue sky in the background.
metadata.story: A bit of green brightens up this otherwise dull grey building in Taipei. Not sure how safe this is during a typhoon though.

metadata.title: YouBikes at Exit 3
metadata.altText: A row of public rental bikes stand at docks along the wall of a metro exit. The exit sign is number '3'.
metadata.story: A metro exit in a residential area of Taipei with public rental bikes right outside.

metadata.title: 5 secs
metadata.altText: Scooters waiting at a red light with 5 seconds showing on the countdown. They are ready to go under an overpass.

metadata.title: Xinyi 101
metadata.altText: A tall green glass tower stands in the backroung. A street sign pointing towards it reads 'Xinyi Rd Sect. 4'. Multiple other signs are stuck to the same street post.
metadata.story: Taipei 101 is a pretty impressive work of engineering. Just search for video of it during a typhoon or earthquake.

metadata.title: MRT Shilin Station
metadata.altText: A metro train is stopped at the train station under a supporting cable. The station hoardings are marked with a red line.
metadata.story: Most folks get off at Shilin Station because they're heading to the night market, but for some of us it's the place to alight for Touch Footy.

metadata.title: Balconies and blue skies
metadata.altText: A photo looking up at the blue sky, with the upper floor balaconies of an apartment building visible in the lower half of the shot.
metadata.story: On sunny days, I like to look at the sunset casting its light on the balconies along our street. On rainy days, I like to watch as temporary waterfalls are created, cascading off them.

metadata.title: Statue by the Ganges
metadata.altText: A white statue of a Hindu deity sit in a golden glass encased box next to a red gated staircase.
metadata.story: This deity was looking out over the River Ganges on a sunny morning in Rishikesh.

metadata.title: Praying to the River
metadata.altText: A man stands at the bottom step on the banks of the River Ganges, raising his arms in prayer. Other people sit in the shaded parts of the stairs, which lead down to the river from a temple entrance.
metadata.story: Worship is a large part in Indian culture, and it was especially evident staying close to the banks of the River Ganges in Rishikesh.

metadata.title: Hiking to Yamunotri
metadata.altText: People and horses jostle for position on a dirt road at the start of a hike.
metadata.story: We hiked for 3 hours to reach the temple at Yamunotri. You might think somewhere so religous would be a peaceful experience, but this was far from it. For the entire three hours we were pushed to the side of the road as donkies and porters carried people up the path. "Left side, left side" was a common refrain we'd hear from the people behind.

metadata.title: Yamunotri Temple
metadata.altText: Yellow and red conical shaped roofs appear in the front of the picture. A sunlit valley is visible in the distant background.
metadata.story: This photo doesn't capture the chaos that was unfolding all around us as worshippers clamoured to get close to the source of the Yamuna river and receive its blessings.

metadata.title: Recieving guidance
metadata.altText: A priest gives instructions to a female worshipper seated on the floor.
metadata.story: We were a large group, and could barely fit into the tight space in the temple to hear the guidance being given to us by this holy man.

metadata.title: More than window shopping
metadata.altText: Three women in bright orange and green saries look at jewellery and bracelets in a brightly lit stall.
metadata.story: I've got absolutely no recollection of taking this photo.

metadata.title: Kings of the road
metadata.altText: A bull stands in the path of two scooters trying to squeeze past it through a narrow shopping street
metadata.story: Cows and bulls dominate the roads of India, causing traffic to swerve around them or just holding things up entirely.

metadata.title: Hanuman at night
metadata.altText: A half-monkey, half-man god statue is brightly lit at night while worshippers take selfies in front of it.
metadata.story: There were plenty of Hanuman statues around Rishikesh. I'm not sure why, but there were. This was the biggest one I saw.

metadata.title: Late night snacks
metadata.altText: Men stand around in the red glow of a neon street sign, waiting for a street vendor to serve them.
metadata.story: Towards the end of our trip, after we'd left the main tour group, I got the chance to wander out and try more street food. It took me back to my childhood when we'd visit India regularly as a family.

metadata.title: Heading to morning prayers at the River
metadata.altText: People walk away from the camera, under an archway topped with a statue of a deity. They are heading towards a river that is just visible in the background.
metadata.story: Early mornings in Rishikesh were blissfully quiet. I took this picture while wandering down towards the River Ganges early one morning. Worshippers make their way towards the river with bottles to fill with the river's water.

metadata.title: Stop for a coffee
metadata.altText: An older man dressing in orange robes sits barefooted on the stairs in front of a hole-in-the-wall coffee shop.

metadata.title: Fire rituals in the River
metadata.altText: Five people sit on a platform at the edge of a river at night. In front of them 5 fires a lit. Behind them a large crowd of people watch on.
metadata.story: The nightly rituals along the River Ganges in Rishikesh can be heard throughout the town (unless you're stuck in traffic, then you just hear car horns).

metadata.title: Make me a sitar
metadata.altText: A man sits at a workbench in a shop. Sitars and other stringed instruments hang in the window behind him.
metadata.story: We spent a good part of our day in Delhi at a very famous musical shop - Rikhiram's. The owner had made instruments for some major performers, but still had time to talk to us and explain the details of the instruments we were interested in.

metadata.title: Chaiwala
metadata.altText: A man pours tea from a pot at a streetside stall. Other men stand just off the road watching. Behind them, traffic goes past.
metadata.story: A chai everyday keeps the doctor away. Or something like that.

metadata.title: Taking in the view
metadata.altText: Two children sit atop a small enclosure facing a large mosque dome.

metadata.title: Jama Masjid
metadata.altText: A mosque appears above an orange coloured wall.
metadata.story: We got to Jama Masjid just as the evening prayers were starting. We could go inside the mosque grounds, but not inside the building itself.

metadata.title: The chaos of Chandni Chwok
metadata.altText: Rickshaws and lorries move in narrow, crowded streets in between old buildings. The evening sun shines bright into the shot.
metadata.story: I love this picture that captures the chaos in the streets of Old Delhi.

metadata.title: Buy a bottle
metadata.altText: A man sits in a stall surround by plastic containers of different colours.
metadata.story: A lot of people take home water from their visits to the holy rivers in India. We did the same, but got duped at one of the places into thinking we needed to carry a lot of water to another location for a ceremony. Oh well - it was still very clean & nice to drink!

metadata.title: Walking towards Gangotri
metadata.altText: People dressed in warm winter hiking gear with backpacks walk through a market towards the morning sun.
metadata.story: We got to Gangotri really early in the day, which made for a nice change in that we avoided most of the crowds and noise that came as the morning progressed.

metadata.title: Puja at Gangotri
metadata.altText: Worshipers sit in a circle while a priest conducts a religious ceremony on the banks of a river.
metadata.story: There was a lot happening along the banks of the Ganges at Gangotri. I'm not sure if the altitude or the harsh morning sun played with my film, but I managed to capture this photo of some worshipers taking part in a ceremony.

metadata.title: Towards the temple
metadata.altText: A crowd of people walking in both directions on a flight of stairs. Those at the top reach above them to ring a large bell.
metadata.story: The crowd heading down towards the Ganges riverside meeting those heading up towards the Gangotri temple.

metadata.title: Himalayas at dusk
metadata.altText: A ridge of snow capped mountain peaks with the last bits of light casting a pinkish hue on their tops.
metadata.story: I've got no idea how I captured this photo. Technically my camera shouldn't have allowed me to. Anyway, that's some peaks of the Himalayas at dusk right there.

metadata.title: Entering the temple
metadata.altText: People enter a very colourful temple area. Coloured flags hang from above, with the yellow temple building in the background.
metadata.story: A dreamy picture at one of the many temples we visited.

metadata.title: A peak of the mountains
metadata.altText: A snow capped mountain rises up between two hills.
metadata.story: We stayed opposite this view for one night in Badrinath.

metadata.title: A temple and baths by the river
metadata.altText: Hot baths line the banks of a flowing river, with a temple situated on the hill behind them.
metadata.story: There always seemed to be a lot of commotion in Badrinath as people tried to get to the baths and the temple.

metadata.title: After the rituals
metadata.altText: A holy man sits besides the empty plates of a finished ritual. A river flows under a bridge behind him.

metadata.title: Temple lanterns at night
metadata.altText: Two bright orange lanterns hang illuminated at the entrance of a temple at night.
metadata.story: Wandering around the streets of Asakusabashi at night, I found this little temple between the buildings. It was a rainy night, so there was no one else around, allowing me to get a good shot of the lanterns hanging at the temple entrance.

metadata.title: Vending machine lights
metadata.altText: A brightly lit vending machine sits off center in an otherwise dark frame.
metadata.story: A late night wander isn't complete without a stop for a drink.

metadata.title: Commuter
metadata.altText: A man waits on the platform as a train pulls into the station in front of him. The man is dressed in a black suit and pants.
metadata.story: Waiting for a very early morning train heading out of Tokyo toward Chiba.

metadata.title: Sky tree
metadata.altText: The spire of a building is lit up with clouds floating around it. The building is partially blocked by a low building in the foreground.
metadata.story: I'd never been to the area around Tokyo Sky Tree at night, but I was staying kinda nearby this time so made a few visits.

metadata.title: Sento
metadata.altText: The entrance of a Japanese public bath is lit up at night. The roofing covering the entrance is green in colour, with some Japanese characters written across it.
metadata.story: Sento is life. Life is Sento.

metadata.title: 2024 Japan Nationals
metadata.altText: Men playing a game of Touch Football, with a person in a light cream shirt attacking the scoreline while a player in a dark jersey has slipped over while defending.
metadata.story: The main reason I was in Tokyo this time was to referee at the Japan Nationals. Always a very fast, very tough, but very rewarding run.

metadata.title: Three's a crowd
metadata.altText: Three people stand separated in an otherwise empty grandstand. A sign in front of them reads "Japan Touch".
metadata.story: It's a small Touch community in Japan, but they still punch well above their weight internationally.

metadata.title: Tokyo Junkies
metadata.altText: A group of players stand on the sideline, watching the team play on the field.
metadata.story: Junkies were the reigning champions heading into this tournament, however they just missed out on the prize in the Final this time. Congrats to the Bulldogs.

metadata.title: Leaving the Sento
metadata.altText: A lady pushes a bike down a ramp, while another ducks under a banner at the entrance of a public bath.
metadata.story: Another one of the Sento (public baths) that I visited during the few days I was in Tokyo. I like the local, no fuss vibes of these places.

metadata.title: Garbage.
metadata.altText: Trash is neatly arranged at the base of a sign post on the street side.

metadata.title: Platforms
metadata.altText: A woman walks aways from the camera having just got off the traing stopped at an otherwise empty platform.
metadata.story: Japan Nationals happens in Chiba prefecture, which is about an hour outside of Tokyo city. Although it's so close to Tokyo, it really feels like you're in a rural area when you get off the train.

metadata.title: Launderying
metadata.altText: A bike sits at the entrance of a laundromat, the machines behind it brightly lit against the night.
metadata.story: A lot of public baths have laundry facilities attached to them. Another money spinner for the owners I suppose, and a nice combo - wash your clothes, have a bath yourself.

metadata.title: Tracks and trees
metadata.altText: The foreground of the picture is dominated by a train station platform and train line next to it under a bridge. The bridge is covered with a large tree, and more greenery lines the side of the tracks. The sky above is clear and blue.
metadata.story: Getting around Sydney by train means a lot of waiting around and hoping that there's not a cancellation.

metadata.title: New and old UTS
metadata.altText: An old industrial building is on the right of the shot, alongside a garden walkway. In the background is a newly designed university building on the left, with an older building to the right of it.
metadata.story: UTS has changed a lot since I was studying there in 2008, but that old, ugly looking main building will always stay the same.

metadata.title: Cricket outside the SCG
metadata.altText: Kids playing cricket in a large open field, with blue skies above. Two large stadiums dominate the background of the shot.
metadata.story: I was running late for the Swans game, but stopped off to watch this kids games for a few balls.

metadata.title: Cheer, cheer the red and the white
metadata.altText: A wide shot of the Sydney Cricket Ground during a match, with spectators filling the stands and players on the green field. The city skyline is visible in the background.
metadata.story: Since leaving Sydney in 2012, I've not had the chance to be in town when the Swans were playing. I was stoked that this year I could get to the opening two rounds.

metadata.title: Blustery in the 'burbs
metadata.altText: A palm tree blows in the strong breeze on a street corner. A white  old house is on the left of the frame, while a man crosses the road near the right of the shot.
metadata.story: We had some really good weather for the most part on this trip to Sydney, but towards the end the wind really picked up for a few days.

metadata.title: Pigeon on Agar Steps
metadata.altText: A pigeon sits on a ledge alongside a building.
metadata.story: This fella was just chilling next to the entrance of a sandwich shop waiting to get some crumbs.

metadata.title: Outlook at the lookout
metadata.altText: A female wearing hiking clothes has her back to the camera. She is looking out over green trees that extend out over hills in the background.
metadata.story: We spent a nice few days in Wentworth Falls taking in the serenity of the Blue Mountains.

metadata.title: Three sisters
metadata.altText: The Three Sisters rock formation stands in the foreground, illuminated by soft light of the setting sun against a backdrop of a vast, hazy mountain range under a partly cloudy sky.
metadata.story: We got the the Blue Mountains in the early afternoon, and were lucky enough to get to the Three Sisters in time to enjoy a beautiful sunset.

metadata.title: Behind Taipei Mosque
metadata.altText: A street scene in a small alley. The frame is dominated by a mosque building in the background. A car drives through the frame in front of the mosque, while a residential apartment building is lit by the midday sun on the left of the shot.
metadata.story: I wander the streets around Taipei mosque often as I make my way home from dropping my partner off to her yoga classes. The mosque itself is often alive with activity on the weekend, with different events that celebrate the varied cultures of Taiwan's Muslim population.

metadata.title: Taipei fruit vendor
metadata.altText: A blue truck is in the center of the picture with its back open with fruits and vegetables on display. An eldery lady is looking at the produce on display.
metadata.story: Blue trucks like this one are a staple on Taiwan's streets. They serve so many functions, from being mobile home repair vehicles, to selling items like this fruit truck that's regularly near a temple around our apartment.
